did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Anua de 1626 en los misiones de San Ignació 1626
did.abstract: Diego de Guzmán was a Jesuit Visitador to the missions in northern Mexico in 1628. Collection includes holograph anua, bautismos, and reports on the missions of San Ignacío y sus pueblos de visitas at Mayo, Yaqui, Nebome, Chínipas, and Cicibotari. Includes Carta del Padre Diego de Guzmán, 16 de Septiembre de 1629.

repository.label: Repository

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired as gift of Paul M. Roca, 1980.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Juan Varela was a Jesuit Visitador to the missions in northern Mexico in 1628 and 1629.
Diego de Guzmán was a Jesuit Visitador to the missions in northern Mexico in 1628.
At the time this document was written, the Rectorado de San Ignacio comprised all the territory north of the Rio Mayo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Holograph anua, bautismos, and reports on the missions of San Ignacío y sus pueblos de visitas at Mayo, Yaqui, Nebome, Chínipas, and Cicibotari. Includes Carta del Padre Diego de Guzmán, 16 de Septiembre de 1629.
Includes Spanish transcription by Campbell W. Pennington.

relatedmaterial.p: Photocopy. Berkeley, Ca. : University of California, Bancroft Library. From the Bolton Collection.
